Package thirdparty.dlib.optimization

Class LBFGSOptimization

java.lang.Object
thirdparty.dlib.optimization.LBFGSOptimization
public class LBFGSOptimization extends Object
a port to java of dlib optimization method find_min. The only search strategy ported is LBFGS, so the search strategy argument is specific, but could be generalized if more than one is implemented, and then find_min abstracted... Limited-memory BFGS is an optimization algorithm in the family of quasi-Newton methods (finds zeroes or local maxima and minima of functions) that approximates the Broyden–Fletcher–Goldfarb–Shanno (BFGS) algorithm using a limited amount of computer memory. It is a popular algorithm for parameter estimation in machine learning the dlib project has copyright: Copyright (C) 2008 Davis E. King (davis@dlib.net) License: Boost Software License See LICENSE.txt for the full license.

  • Method Details

    • findMin

      public double findMin(LBFGSSearchStrategy searchStrategy, ObjectiveDeltaStopStrategy stopStrategy, IFunction f, double[] x, double minF)
      Parameters:
      searchStrategy - an object that defines a search strategy
      stopStrategy - an object that defines a stop strategy
      f - function returning a double
      x - coefficients used by f and der
      minF - stop_strategy decides that an acceptable point has been found or f(#x) less than min_f
      Returns:
      the return value from optimized run of function f.
